cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 mi SE of Corpus Christi Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, expected to stall near or just inland after landfall

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande; Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield to the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Sargent; Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island; Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island and south of Port Mansfield to the Rio Grande
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield through High Island, including Corpus Christi area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely by Friday afternoon with hurricane-force winds (75–85+ mph) possible Friday night into Saturday; gusts could exceed 100 mph if Harvey reaches major status at landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 6–12 ft of life-threatening surge possible from North Entrance Padre Island National Seashore through and just northeast of Corpus Christi, accompanied by large destructive waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches of rain with isolated maxima of 35 inches expected, producing devastating, life-threatening flooding in and around Corpus Christi.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands, prolonged power outages, and port‐area inundation from both rainfall and surge.
